data.text:
Amid the lush pomp of his Manhattan hotel, Sir Ben Kingsley looks displeased. The Oscar-winning actor is known for his personal sense of grandeur and for liking things to be just so. He is a stickler for grammar and can be tetchy with interviewers. Only the foolhardy would forget for a second that this 71-year-old doctorâ€™s son, who was brought up in Manchester, is a knight of the realm.

Right now, his shaven head is bent over a tea tray that has been sent up to the 38th-floor suite. He examines the trio of teabags, leaves contained in expensive-looking silken sachets.
